title: Queue changes (Draft update + Ranked change)
body:
https://i.imgur.com/S6Y3cSn.png

Hi Summoners,
~~~
#Normal Draft

**TL;DR**
After two weeks the test has gone reasonably well. For the remainder of the test period we will be expanding the times and days Normal Draft is available. From 05/10/2017 until 19/10/2017 Normal Draft will be on EVERYDAY from 3pm to 1am AEDT. 
~~~
I wanted to provide an update around how the test is going so far and what we are going to be doing for the remaining two weeks of the test.

As we mentioned in the [original announcement](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/WEAy3U0l-normal-draft-test-coming-to-oceania) the test will run until the 19th of October (can’t believe we are halfway through already!). We have had Normal Draft enabled for 2 weeks now, Thursday to Sunday between 6pm and 11pm AEST/AEDT. What we have seen so far is that players have really been enjoying Draft when it is available and it is currently hovering around 17% of total normal games from a usage standpoint (when comparing the two queues while Draft is open).

The first two weeks have shown us how it looks when it is in a conservatively windowed format and what we want to do for the remaining two weeks is try an aggressive windowed test. We will be expanding the days and times it is available to see what kind of impact this has on the queue (and other queues).
 
##**So from 05/10/2017 until 19/10/2017 Normal Draft will be on EVERYDAY from 3pm to 1am AEDT**. 

While this is an aggressive change, we wanted to take the opportunity of this test period to see how it goes. I want to be clear that this does not guarantee that Draft will stay available in the same state after the test is over.
 
-Note remember to lock in your picks and bans in Draft!

~~~
#Ranked changes

We also have some changes to Ranked queue times. It’s been awhile since we reviewed the state of our Ranked queues. 

##**We have made Solo/Duo queue available 24/7 and adjusted the Flex queue disabled times to be between 5am - 8am each day effective immediately.**##

**Solo queue context**: After reviewing the long-term experience in the queue, we now feel comfortable that turning on Solo/Duo queue 24/7 will not have a negative impact on the health of the Solo/Duo queue or any other queue. 

**Flex queue context**: Until now, we’ve had disabled times for both Solo/Duo and Flex. When we originally set these disable times, we didn’t want to have both ranked queues unavailable at the same time. This meant that we spread the disable time evenly across both modes during the quietest time of the day (4 AM - 10 AM AEST).  

Given that we’ve been able to confirm that having Solo/Duo on 24/7 should not cause any issues - and long term data around when and how players take part in Flex Queue, we’re comfortable with not changing the number of hours Flex Queue is available. Instead, our plan is  moving it’s disable time to cover the 3 least active hours of the day (5AM-8AM)

If we do begin to see any major queue time or matchmaking concerns for either Solo/Duo or Flex, such as degraded quality of games outside of the quieter hours, then we’ll revisit this decision and adjust again if necessary.

If you want full info about when which queues are on check out the [Queue Schedule post](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/wgM0WBsO-queue-schedule-updated-feb-8th).

Once again keep sharing your feedback and showing us your favourite queue by playing it. Thank you for your continued support and good luck on the Rift!

Hi Vegathron,

What you're describing is exactly the pattern of behaviour we saw when we first introduced lock-in requirements to ranked queues (draft normals has always had this as well, OCE just didn't have draft normals back then).
For the first couple of weeks, players were accidentally dodging games continuously despite the lock-in warning popups that came with the change, and feedback was that it was a terrible and unnecessary change.

But we stuck with it and sure enough after those first couple of weeks, players learned to lock-in their picks. Locking in picks led to massive decreases in time taken in champ-select and how long it takes to go from the play button to the game loading screen. Players getting into game faster, means getting out of game faster, which means getting into their next game faster.
Having less players sitting in a passive state waiting for the champ select timer to countdown when they already know what they want to play, means more players either in game or in queue. Which in turn means better matchmaking and lower queue times as there is a larger pool of players to match.

So while I get that for now it is a bit of an annoyance to see players dodge because they forgot to lock in, it won't take long for everyone to start remembering to lock-in, and when they do it will be worth it.

**_If it was possible to have a consistently positive experience with these modes, right now, with them being active all of the time, we would do it in a heartbeat._**

The way that we choose the times to have modes active is around the times that the most players are active and playing games. 

Our core goal with the timing game modes is to maximize the amount of modes that are available for as many players as possible without it having significant problems with the quality of matchmaking / time to get a game. 

I know it sucks to miss out on this (I really do, my favourite modes in League have been Dominion and Twisted Treeline) - but we're doing it this way to get as many players as possible to play as much as possible. The good news is, the more that people play this mode, the more we're able to stretch the time that the mode is active. 

We plan to constantly keep an eye on the state and activity of the queue - and increase the active time as aggressively as we can.
